title: About the SBLGNT
text: Society Biblical Literature, keeping mission foster biblical scholarship, pleased sponsor, association Logos Bible Software, new, critically edited edition Greek New Testament. SBL Greek New Testament (SBLGNT), freely available electronic form, useful students, teachers, translators, scholars wide variety settings contexts.

title: About the SBLGNT
text: many benefits features widely used “standard text” Greek New Testament (.e., Nestle-Aland United Bible Societies editions) well known widely appreciated, meet needs users. example, many scholars students, especially living -resourced regions, easy access --date critically edited Greek New Testament electronic form. Thus, teachers wish include portions Greek New Testament class assignments use Greek New Testament scholarly research publications often must input Greek text letter letter, tedious subject error. Students writing exegetical papers face similar obstacles challenges. address need, SBLGNT available electronic form scholar student may freely download portions text personal study, research, use scholarly publications. addition, text encoded Unicode-compliant font, SBL Greek, users can exchange work easily without purchase proprietary Greek font. short, contemporary, critically edited text Greek New Testament now widely freely available.

what: The Text-Critical Task Is Not Finished
title: About the SBLGNT
text: new text may benefits well. standard text viewed use “final” text passively accepted rather “working” text subject verification improvement. example, exegetical habits scholars students seem reflect belief important text-critical work already completed, one can less equate standard Greek New Testament “original” text. mindset , surprising entire commentaries written simply take standard text printed scarcely discuss textual matters. circumstances , existence alternative critically edited text—SBLGNT differs standard text 540 variation units—help remind readers Greek New Testament text-critical task finished. what: Access to the Leningrad Codex Version of the Old Testament,the Greek New Testament, and the Revised American Standard Bible
title: Access to the Leningrad Codex Version of the Old Testament,the Greek New Testament, and the Revised American Standard Bible
text: goal logos give access Greek New Testament (27 books) Tanach (39 books) allow users textual analysis data. New Old Testament provided original languages, Greek Hebrew, respectively. Additionally, English Standard Version (ESV) Revised American Standard Bible (RASB) also provided users ’d rather use word––word modern (1901) English translation.

title: Access to the Leningrad Codex Version of the Old Testament,the Greek New Testament, and the Revised American Standard Bible
text: can install development version logos like : download package CRAN like :

text: basic example shows solve common problem:

what: Author Data for Biblical Books — author_data
title: Author Data for Biblical Books — author_data
text: dataset containing information authors, books, sections, languages Bible.

title: Author Data for Biblical Books — author_data
Author Data for Biblical Books — author_data
text: data frame 66 rows 6 variables: author Character. Name author (e.g., "Moses"). books Character. Name book(s) authored. section Character. Section Bible (e.g., "Law", "History"). date Character. Approximate date authorship (e.g., "c. 1445-1405 BC"). testament Character. Testament classification ("Old Testament" "New Testament"). language Character. Language book originally written (e.g., "Hebrew").

title: Author Data for Biblical Books — author_data
text: dataset summarizes metadata biblical authors, sections, book classifications.

what: Retrieve standardized book names based on biblical authors — by_author
title: Retrieve standardized book names based on biblical authors — by_author
text: Collect book names RASB Bible, Leningrad Codex, Septuagint based biblical authors outlined 'author_data' dataset. Moses: Genesis – Deuteronomy Joshua: Joshua Unkown: Judges, Ruth, 1 & 2 Kings, 1 & Chronicles, Esther Job Samuel/Unknown: 1 & 2 Samuel Ezra: Ezra Nehemiah: Nehemiah David/Various: Psalms Solomon: Proverbs, Ecclesiastes, Song Solomon Isaiah: Isaiah Jeremiah: Jeremiah Lamentations Ezekiel: Ezekiel Daniel: Daniel Hosea: Hosea Joel: Joel Amos: Amos Obadiah: Obadiah Jonah: Jonah Micah: Micah Nahum: Nahum Habakkuk: Habakkuk Zephaniah: Zephaniah Haggai: Haggai Zechariah: Zechariah Malachi: Malachi Matthew: Gospel Matthew Mark: Gospel Mark Luke: Gospel Luke Acts John: Gospel John, Johanine epistles Revelation Paul: Pauline epistles James: James Peter: 1 2 Peter Jude: Jude Unknown: Hebrews

title: Retrieve standardized book names based on biblical authors — by_author
Retrieve standardized book names based on biblical authors — by_author
text: author character vector length 1 specifying biblical author Old New Testament testament character vector length 1 specifying testament/time period author found

title: Retrieve standardized book names based on biblical authors — by_author
text: character vector standardized book names passed functions

what: Retrieve standardized book names based on probable writing period — by_date
title: Retrieve standardized book names based on probable writing period — by_date
text: Collect book names RASB Bible, Leningrad Codex, Septuagint based dates outlined 'author_data' dataset.

title: Retrieve standardized book names based on probable writing period — by_date
Retrieve standardized book names based on probable writing period — by_date
text: date_range character vector length 1, written date range, "1445 - 1405 BC", specifying probable writing period Old New Testament books testament character vector length 1 specifying testament corresponding provided date range

title: Retrieve standardized book names based on probable writing period — by_date
text: character vector standardized book names passed functions

what: Retrieve standardized book names based on biblical narrative styles or genres — by_section
title: Retrieve standardized book names based on biblical narrative styles or genres — by_section
text: Collect book names RASB Bible, Leningrad Codex, Septuagint based narrative styles outlined 'author_data' dataset. Law: Genesis – Deuteronomy History: Joshua – Esther Wisdom: Job – Songs Solomon Major Prophets: Isaiah - Daniel Minor Prophets: Hosea – Malachi Gospels: Matthew – John Pauline Epistles: Romans – Philemon General Epistles: Hebrews – Jude Apocalyptic: Revelation

title: Retrieve standardized book names based on biblical narrative styles or genres — by_section
Retrieve standardized book names based on biblical narrative styles or genres — by_section
text: section character vector length 1 specifying narrative section genre Old New Testament testament character vector length 1 specifying testament section found

title: Retrieve standardized book names based on biblical narrative styles or genres — by_section
text: character vector standardized book names passed functions

title: Get Bible Version — get_bible_version
text: Retrieves Bible data filtered specified language testament.

title: Get Bible Version — get_bible_version
Get Bible Version — get_bible_version
text: language character string specifying language Bible. Must one "English", "Hebrew", "Greek". testament character string specifying testament. input standardized using standardize_testament() typically "Old Testament", "New Testament", "".

title: Get Bible Version — get_bible_version
text: data frame containing Bible data corresponding selected language testament.

title: Get Bible Version — get_bible_version
text: function filters underlying Bible dataset based specified language testament. English, divides dataset Old New Testaments using predefined book ranges rasb_bible dataset. Hebrew Greek, refers old_testament new_testament datasets respectively, produce error unsupported combination requested.

what: Get Fraction of a Chapter or Book — get_fraction
title: Get Fraction of a Chapter or Book — get_fraction
text: Extracts specified fraction chapter given book portion book.

title: Get Fraction of a Chapter or Book — get_fraction
code: get_fraction(book, chapter, fraction, part, language = NULL, testament = NULL)

title: Get Fraction of a Chapter or Book — get_fraction
text: book character string vector specifying book(s) chapter retrieved. chapter numeric vector indicating chapter number(s) processed. fraction numeric value representing total number sections chapter divided. Must integer greater equal 1. part numeric value indicating section divided chapter return. Must satisfy 1 <= part <= fraction. language optional character string indicating language Bible. Typically one "English", "Hebrew", "Greek". Default NULL. testament optional character string specifying testament. "Old Testament", "New Testament", "". Default NULL.

title: Get Fraction of a Chapter or Book — get_fraction
text: character vector containing verses specified section chapter.

title: Get Fraction of a Chapter or Book — get_fraction
text: function validates fraction part parameters, retrieves full chapter text using retrieve_chapter(), calculates corresponding section chapter return. chapter divided equal parts based number verses, function extracts verses corresponding requested part.

title: The Society of Biblical Literature Greek New Testament — new_testament
The Society of Biblical Literature Greek New Testament — new_testament
text: data frame 7,939 rows 5 variables: book Character. Name book (e.g., "1Cor"). chapter Character. Chapter number. verse Character. Verse number. text Character. Text verse Greek. greek_name Character. Greek name book.

title: The Society of Biblical Literature Greek New Testament — new_testament
text: dataset provides Greek text New Testament along book chapter metadata.

title: Old Testament Dataset — old_testament
text: dataset containing text Old Testament Hebrew book metadata. Unicode/XML Leningrad Codex (UXLC) transcription Leningrad Codex (LC) modern computer format (Unicode, XML). UXLC text fork Groves Center's Westminster Leningrad Codex  WLC 4.20, 2016

title: Old Testament Dataset — old_testament
Old Testament Dataset — old_testament
text: data frame 23,213 rows 5 variables: book Character. Name book (e.g., "Amos"). chapter Numeric. Chapter number. verse Numeric. Verse number. text Character. Text verse Hebrew. hebrew_names Character. Hebrew name book.

title: Old Testament Dataset — old_testament
text: dataset provides Hebrew text Old Testament along book chapter metadata.

what: Take a Quick Overview of Your Data — peek
title: Take a Quick Overview of Your Data — peek
text: peek() provides transposed view dataset: columns displayed vertically, data column shown horizontally. layout allows inspect columns data.frame glance. serves convenient wrapper around utils::str(), added benefit invisibly returning input object, making suitable use data pipelines.

title: Take a Quick Overview of Your Data — peek
Take a Quick Overview of Your Data — peek
text: x object inspected. width integer(1). Specifies maximum width output. ... Additional arguments pass utils::str().

title: Take a Quick Overview of Your Data — peek
text: input object x, returned invisibly.

title: Take a Quick Overview of Your Data — peek
RASB Bible — rasb_bible
text: public domain dataset containing text Bible Revised American Standard Bible (RASB).

title: RASB Bible — rasb_bible
RASB Bible — rasb_bible
text: data frame 31,102 rows 4 variables: book Character. Name book (e.g., "Gen"). chapter Integer. Chapter number. verse Integer. Verse number. text Character. Text verse.

title: RASB Bible — rasb_bible
text: dataset provides full English text Bible RASB translation.

what: Retrieve a specific chapter or portion of a chapter from the Bible — retrieve_chapter
title: Retrieve a specific chapter or portion of a chapter from the Bible — retrieve_chapter
text: function retrieves text specified book chapter, optional filtering verse, partitioning, language selection.

title: Retrieve a specific chapter or portion of a chapter from the Bible — retrieve_chapter
code: retrieve_chapter(   book,   chapter = NULL,   verse = NULL,   fraction = NULL,   part = NULL,   language,   testament )

title: Retrieve a specific chapter or portion of a chapter from the Bible — retrieve_chapter
text: book character string specifying book Bible. chapter numeric character vector specifying chapter(s) retrieve. verse optional numeric vector specifying specific verses retrieve. fraction numeric value indicating many equal parts divide chapter . part numeric value specifying part return (must 1 fraction). language character string specifying language Bible text. Options "English", "Hebrew", "Greek". testament character string specifying whether retrieve Old New Testament.

title: Retrieve a specific chapter or portion of a chapter from the Bible — retrieve_chapter
text: character vector containing retrieved Bible text.

what: Select a book, passage or portion of a book from the old or new testament — select_passage
title: Select a book, passage or portion of a book from the old or new testament — select_passage
text: Retrieves whole book(s), passage book portion book chapter, based specified criteria book, chapter, verse, alternative selection using author, section, date.

title: Select a book, passage or portion of a book from the old or new testament — select_passage
code: select_passage(   book = NULL,   chapter = NULL,   verse = NULL,   fraction = 1,   part = 1,   by = NULL,   divider = NULL,   language = "English",   testament = NULL )

title: Select a book, passage or portion of a book from the old or new testament — select_passage
text: book character vector specifying book name(s) select passage. Ignored parameter provided. chapter numeric vector indicating chapter(s) book. selection section, author date used, chapter must set NULL. verse numeric vector indicating verse(s) within chapter. fraction numeric value (default 1) indicating many equal parts divide chapter . part numeric value specifying part return (must 1 fraction). optional character string alternative selection criteria. one "author", "section", "date". provided, book, chapter, verse parameters must NULL. divider character vector specifying author, section date range selected. language character string indicating language passage. Must one "English", "Hebrew", "Greek". Default "English". testament character string specifying testament. Must one "Old", "New", "" (case-insensitive). parameter required.

title: Select a book, passage or portion of a book from the old or new testament — select_passage
text: Returns selected passage generated retrieve_chapter() function.

title: Select a book, passage or portion of a book from the old or new testament — select_passage
text: function validates input parameters determines book(s) used based provided criteria. argument given, function leverages helper functions by_author(), by_section(), by_date() select appropriate book(s) based alternative criterion. passage retrieved via retrieve_chapter(), applying verse filtering partitioning based fraction part arguments.

title: Select a book, passage or portion of a book from the old or new testament — select_passage
code: # Example 1: Select a passage by specifying book, chapter, and verse. select_passage(book = "Genesis", chapter = 1, verse = 1, testament = "Old") #> [1] "In the beginning God created the heavens and the earth." select_passage(book = "Mat", chapter = 1, verse = 1:10, testament = "new") #> Did you mean: Mth ? #>  [1] "The book of the generation of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son of Abraham."              #>  [2] "Abraham begot Isaac; and Isaac begot Jacob; and Jacob begot Judah and his brothers;"            #>  [3] "and Judah begot Perez and Zerah of Tamar; and Perez begot Hezron; and Hezron begot Ram;"        #>  [4] "and Ram begot Amminadab; and Amminadab begot Nahshon; and Nahshon begot Salmon;"                #>  [5] "and Salmon begot Boaz of Rahab; and Boaz begot Obed of Ruth; and Obed begot Jesse;"             #>  [6] "and Jesse begot David the king.And David begot Solomon of her that had been the wife of Uriah;" #>  [7] "and Solomon begot Rehoboam; and Rehoboam begot Abijah; and Abijah begot Asa;"                   #>  [8] "and Asa begot Jehoshaphat; and Jehoshaphat begot Joram; and Joram begot Uzziah;"                #>  [9] "and Uzziah begot Jotham; and Jotham begot Ahaz; and Ahaz begot Hezekiah;"                       #> [10] "and Hezekiah begot Manasseh; and Manasseh begot Amon; and Amon begot Josiah;"

Validate book names against a reference list — validate_book

title: Verses by Book — verses_by_book
text: dataset containing number verses book Bible.

title: Verses by Book — verses_by_book
Verses by Book — verses_by_book
text: data frame 66 rows 2 variables: book character vector containing abbreviated book names (e.g., "1Chr", "1Cor", "1John", "1Kgs", "1Pet", "1Sam", "1Thess", "1Tim", etc.). n integer vector representing number verses corresponding book.

title: Verses by Book — verses_by_book
text: dataset provides summary verse counts book Bible. useful biblical studies, allowing quick reference structure biblical texts facilitating statistical analysis.
